title: Toxic Discharges from North Carolina Factory Contaminate Drinking Water for Nearly 1 Million Residents - NewsBreak
text:
saludastandard-sentinel.com
website
North Carolina
Toxic Discharges from North Carolina Factory Contaminate Drinking Water for Nearly 1 Million Residents
By Elena Brooks,
1 days agoASHEBORO, NC â€” A plastics manufacturing plant in central North Carolina has discharged a likely carcinogenic chemical into local waterways for years, impacting drinking water for nearly one million people across the state. Environmental advocates say the situation has reached a crisis point, prompting legal action against both the facility and the city overseeing its waste treatment.
